title: translate()
desc: The translate() function moves or translates an element along the X and Y axes, without affecting other elements around it. It can be useful for animating elements or adjusting their position.

params.name: x
params.desc: Horizontal movement. positive values move right, negative values move left.

params.name: y
params.desc: Vertical movement. positive values move down, negative values move up.

title: rotate()
desc: The rotate() function rotates an element around a central point, specified in degrees. Positive values rotate clockwise, while negative values rotate counterclockwise.

params.name: angle
params.desc: Specifies the degree of rotation in deg, turn or rad.

title: scale()
desc: The scale() function resizes an element along the X and Y axes. You can specify different scaling factors for both axes or use a single value to scale uniformly.

params.name: x
params.desc: Horizontal scaling factor greater than 1 enlarges, less than 1 shrinks.

params.name: y
params.desc: Vertical scaling factor if omitted, the same value as <code>x<code> is applied to both axes.

title: skew()
desc: The skew() function distorts an element by tilting it along the X and Y axes. Itâ€™s useful for creating dynamic effects like slanted elements.

params.name: x-angle
params.desc: Skew angle along the X axis horizontal skew.

params.name: y-angle
params.desc: Skew angle along the Y axis vertical skew.

title: matrix()
desc: The matrix() function combines multiple transform properties (translate, rotate, scale, and skew) into one single function. It takes six params that define the transformation.
syntax: transform: matrix(scaleX, skewY, skewX, scaleY, translateX, translateY);

params.name: scaleX
params.desc: Scaling factor along the X axis.

params.name: scaleY
params.desc: Scaling factor along the Y axis.

params.name: translateX
params.desc: Translation or movement along the X axis.

params.name: translateY
params.desc: Translation or movement along the Y axis.

title: Multiple Transforms
desc: You can apply multiple transformations to a single element by chaining the transform functions together. CSS will apply them in order, from left to right.
explain: This moves the element, rotates it by 30 degrees, and then scales it by 1.2 times.

title: Transform-Origin
desc: The transform-origin property sets the origin point around which the transformation occurs. By default, it is the center of the element, but you can change it.
